title: Heavy Rain: Heavy Rain Forecast For South Tn | Madurai News - Times of India
text: Madurai: Following the heavy rain warning issued by the India Meteorological Department for Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Ramanathapuram, and Tuticorin districts on December 31 and January 1, 2024, the district administrations in Tuticorin and Tirunelveli have alerted people to be cautious, especially those living along the banks of the Thamirabarani .The IMD noted the prevalence of moderate Northeasterlies/easterlies in the lower tropospheric levels over the region. As a result, light to moderate rain is expected to occur at one or two places over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal areas on Friday, with additional forecasts for light to moderate rains at a few places over South Tamil Nadu, and one or two places over North Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal areas on Saturday.The IMD has specifically issued a heavy rain warning for one or two places in Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Ramanathapuram, and Tuticorin districts on December 31 and January 1.The Western Ghats in Tirunelveli district experienced torrential rainfall on Wednesday night, with Oothu in Manjolai area recording 500 mm of rainfall by Thursday morning. Similarly, Nalumukku recorded 400 mm, and Kakkachi and Manjolai areas recorded 300 mm of rainfall. In anticipation of heavy rains, the Tirunelveli district administration initiated the release of water from Manimutharu, Papanasam, and Servalaru reservoirs. The collective discharge from these reservoirs was 2,000 cusecs on Thursday morning, increasing to 5,936 cusecs by 5 pm. The district collector mentioned that the discharge would be further increased based on rainfall and dam inflow.In Tuticorin, the district administration directed all department officials to be present at their offices on December 30, 31, and January 1 without fail. Departments including revenue, local administration, agriculture, dairy and fisheries, health, Tangedco, highways, public works, municipal, and town panchayat were instructed to ensure staff attendance.
